reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Citadines Karasuma-Gojo Kyoto Serviced Apartment(s) is just a minute walk from Gojo Subway Station and 10-minute walk from Kyoto Central Station. 7-11 Convenience Store, Mc Donald’s, 100 Yen Shop, Grocery Stores and a number of local restaurants are just within the vicinity. What a Fantastic Location!
reviews.title: Great location and amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First Impression
reviews.title: Close to subway station! Beautiful Rooms ! Good Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very conveniently located in terms of public transport. Rooms are the most spacious we had in Japan during our trip. OK facilties (it's cheap to do laundry, for example), we didn't have breakfast there so I cannot judge that.
reviews.title: Good location and interior

reviews.text: One thing I really didn't like though is that our window was facing another building's wall. It's not a problem if you are only using the place to sleep after long days of exploring Kyoto, so I didn't even bother asking to change the room, but be aware of it if it's important to you and maybe ask for a normal window view in advance.
reviews.title: Good location and great room size

reviews.text: Spent 2 nights here and it was amazing. The location was ideal as there was a subway station about 1 min walk away. Love the kitchen area which is fully equipped with the basic utensil for basic usage. Wifi was free and fast speed too. The room size is consider large than the rest of the normal Japan accommodation. If I return to Kyoto again, will surely book this place.
reviews.title: Would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great in every way. Would strongly recommend it to anyone. There's a great supermarket a few mins along the road (walk in the opposite direction to Gojo station and its on the left hand side of the road). Room wasn't as big as I expected but looking at the photos they are correct. Windows are good at blocking out noise from the road other than ambulance sirens so bring ear plugs if you're a light sleeper! Kyoto is fab.
reviews.title: Best choice!!! Great location!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is small but clean and comfortable. The hotel has a great location because is ten feet away from the Karasuma line subway station, and this line can take to the best place in little time. The value is great, rooms are comfortable, clean, and with good size. The price is really good considering all facts. Is one of the best value hotels I have ever been. I would totally come back. The best choice in Kyoto.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: I was able to walk easily from the Train Station to the Hotel. It is very dark in the foyer but that lends itself to quietness and calm. The room was very good quality. Buses are nearby as are many of the major shopping areas.
reviews.title: Great location, quiet quality hotel

reviews.text: Like others on TA we were very happy with our six night stay here. The location was good being walking distance from the station - even with luggage. There is a bus stop close by which enables you to travel to many of the touristy places in Kyoto. Just a few buildings away is a small supermarket which supplies all your basic needs for lunches or breakfasts. There are plenty of restaurants with in walking distance for dinner. I don't recommend the breakfast in the hotel - only for the truly desperate. We chose a more roomy apartment which came with a kind sized bed and was quite spacious and very comfortable. This is a great option for a longer stay.
reviews.title: Thoroughly recommended

reviews.text: Chose this hotel based on the review on Tripadvisor. The whole experience was great. The hotel is modern and slick. As you enter the lobby, you are instantly drawn to the calmness and tranquility of the environment. Check-in was smooth. Room is big by Japan standard. Location is perfect, plenty of the attraction within walking distance and the subway is just right outside the hotel. Breakfast is simple, but for the price of US$6, it's value for money. I would stay here again and again....
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: My wife and I travelled with our one year old and liked this hotel. Being so central, we were able to come back by around lunch time for the kid's nap and some play time. The hotel housekeeping staff cleaned our room so well that I felt absolutely comfortable with letting our toddler crawl around and play. We also took advantage of the kitchenette and cooked our kid's meals, since he had special dietary restrictions. A nearby supermarket let us purchase our produce at the beginning of our stay and we stored it in the room's minifridge. An international ATM across the street at the 7Eleven convenience store made it easy to take out money. The hotel had a breakfast that left much to be desired, but for the price of around 6 USD, we couldn't complain. Other hotels charge you around 30 USD for breakfast. Nearby, you have a McDonalds and a Japanese restaurant that serves a well-priced Japanese breakfast.
reviews.title: Great location, perfect for toddlers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the value, cleanliness, location (10 minute walk to Nishiki Market area and to the Kyoto Station area), I would highly recommend this place for couples who want to travel but have no clue how their toddler would handle the changes in environment. The staff was also very professional and helpful in providing details to nearby restaurants, sites, and even Japanese traditional spas. Warning to parents with kids, the rooms are SMALL. The double bed room with the sliding door is ideal for a little toddler and a portable crib, which you could rent from the hotel for around 25 USD a night. If you plan on staying for a week, I recommend purchasing a travel crib for around 180 USD. Good investment for future traveling.
reviews.title: Awesome: value for money

reviews.text: I just arrived in Kyoto and will be here for a few more days. The jury is still out on the overall quality of the hotel, but I am so impressed thus far (it's only been a few hours :-) that I want to write about it.
reviews.title: First impression after check-in
Great aparthotel in the middle of Kyoto
reviews.text: Coming after a week being cooped up in Hong Kong then Tokyo, I had to snap my face when I got into the room in this hotel. This is truly an apartment, generously sized and well equipped. I think the official check-in time is 2PM. I arrived about 30 minutes early and was given a room immediately. My biggest problem was finding the front door to the hotel - hey, it was a long shinkansen ride on a hot day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A sofa in the apartment, microwave and cookware! Bath-tub, with a generous supply of American style towels. A closet with drawers and ample hangers, ironing borad. Many three-prong and two-prong plug-ins. A DVD player. A safe. Extra folding chair. A household appliance guide. Washers and dryers in the basement. English-speaking staff. What a concept!
reviews.title: Great hotel at affordable price!

reviews.text: To be continued --

reviews.text: We spent 4 nights in this hotel near the end of September and had a lovely time.
